bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John T. MacDonald, April 5, 1948

div1.p: Hench informs MacDonald that he has returned from Cuba, where he acquired aerial photographs of Marianao from the Cuban Air Force.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John T. MacDonald, April 5, 1948
div1.opener:
April 5, 1948
Dr. John T. MacDonald
813 Ingraham Bldg.
Miami, Florida.
My dear Doctor MacDonald:
div1.p:
I just returned from a very interesting trip
in Florida and Cuba. Your colleagues in Pan-American
in Havana were very nice to me, thanks to you. But,
unfortunately they found no air-views of Marianao. Final-
ly the Cuban Air Force helped me out and I got my pictures.

I am sorry I am so late in sending you thesee
reprints. The Clinic doesn't see many cases of Filariasis
and this is all we could find. I think the case of
Chyluria was related to Filariasis. I am afraid these wont
be much use to you but I wanted you to have them this week.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH;ktb
